channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for LA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for LA

item.title: Report E-2024070298
item.description:
Report E-2024070298

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-17T18:15:41+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-12
  • City: SHREVEPORT
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal LSL experienced a UN1992 19122 Lacquer Thinner Fast release from (6) 5-gallon metal pails. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released to an 8’ x 10’ area of the trailer floor. The lids of the pails seemed to be leaking as a possible result of being stacked and crushed. The damaged pails were collected into an 85-gallon poly drum. Absorbents were then deployed and worked into the impacted area. The impacted absorbents, pads, pallet pieces, and PPE were collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report X-2024070531
item.description:
Report X-2024070531

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-11T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-05
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The package was found coming out the trailer. The box was wet from the bottom when QA inspected it. It was already in a red tote so they just transported the tote to the hazmat cage to process properly. The package was packed with no inner packing when QA was doing the hazmat damage report and ISF form. The shipper carelessly sent out hazardous products with no protection of the product, thankfully no one was injured in the process.

item.title: Report X-2024070513
item.description:
Report X-2024070513

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-11T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-28
  • City: BATON ROUGE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The package was found in the truck by the package handler from the night previous night. The package handler didn't notice the hazmat on the package because the label evaporated, and the box was torn and crushed. We had to research for the label and thankfully matched the package with the UN Number associated with the bottle. The two bottles that had ethanolamine, were found leaking from the bottom of the bottle. Seem as though there was no inner packing inside the package to protect the product. Being placed in a red bin and being held at the station. More pictures provided for additional information.
